image.altText: Warren Tredrea

items.synopsis: Former sports presenter Warren Tredrea has taken the stand on the first day of a Federal Court trial where he is seeking nearly $6 million in compensation claiming he was unfairly dismissed by Channel 9 South Australia over his refusal to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

title.children: 'Every presenter stumbles': Warren Tredrea tells court his on-air performance was not grounds for dismissal

image.altText: Scott Morrison in house of reps.

items.synopsis: The former prime minister addresses federal parliament for the first time since the royal commission handed down its damning findings earlier this month, doubling down on his rejection of any wrongdoing.

title.children: Scott Morrison accuses the government of 'rank hypocrisy' over Robodebt criticism

image.altText: Sam Kerr is pictured at the Matildas' training session in Brisbane. She is sitting on the track with a foam roller

items.synopsis: It's do-or-die for the Matildas as they take on Canada in Melbourne. They almost certainly need a win to progress in the Women's World Cup. Follow live.

title.children: Sam Kerr to start on bench for Matildas' do-or-die clash against Canada

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Matildas have put out their starting line up. It'll be Foord and Fowler up front to start. You can listen to the match live on ABC Sport here.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Sam Kerr to start on the bench

children.content: The Matildas have put out their starting line up. It'll be Foord and Fowler up front to start.
You can listen to the match live on ABC Sport here.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A first ever win for Zambia!
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: Costa Rica 1 - 3 Zambia

children.content: A first ever win for Zambia!

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Japan unlock Spain's strategy and tear them apart on the counter attack. Highly impressive. Both sides go through to the round of 16 anyway. Japan win the group, emphatically.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: Japan 4 - 0 Spain

children.content: Japan unlock Spain's strategy and tear them apart on the counter attack. Highly impressive.
Both sides go through to the round of 16 anyway. Japan win the group, emphatically.

image.altText: Richard Marles and Angus Campbel at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Shadow Defence Minister Andrew Hastie says the make of helicopter that crashed in Queensland's Whitsundays during a military exercise had well-documented concerns about its airworthiness.

title.children: Government won't expedite replacements for Taipans involved in Queensland chopper crash

image.altText: Corporal Alex Naggs (left), Lieutenant Maxwell Nugent (middle) and Warrant Officer Class 2 Joseph Laycock.

items.synopsis: Activity in Queensland's Whitsundays has changed from search and rescue to a recovery mission, Richard Marles says.

title.children: PM sends condolences to families of crew on crashed chopper as recovery mission commences

image.altText: A man lies on the ground in apparent pain.

items.synopsis: Port Adelaide defender Aliir Aliir will miss the Power's crucial clash with Geelong this week, after the AFL issued the club with a 'please explain' over their concussion protocols from the weekend.

title.children: Power star Aliir Aliir forced to sit out Geelong clash as AFL issues 'please explain' over concussion protocols

image.altText: A mother and her two young sons.

items.synopsis: At just five years of age, Lachie Draper-Shaw began caring for his mother and younger brother, missing out on his first year of school. But more support is now on offer.

title.children: 'It just felt normal': Lachie has been a carer since he was five, and he is not alone

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair sits in a room and smiles.

items.synopsis: A friend of missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer flew to Tasmania and was shown the wilderness area where where the 31-year-old disappeared a month ago, with police reporting a cadaver dog on loan from NSW has found nothing.

title.children: Belgian friend of missing tourist Celine Cremer visits search area with police

image.altText: Two firefighters outside a burning house, one holding a hose. The roof has collapsed.

items.synopsis: A man has been rushed to hospital in a serious condition with severe burns to his entire body following an explosion at a home in Coomera on the northern Gold Coast.

title.children: Explosion, fire treated as suspicious after Gold Coast house is destroyed, man taken to hospital with full-body burns

image.altText: A man yells in celebration after kicking a goal.

items.synopsis: Hawthorn and Sydney champion Lance Franklin — who is one of only six players to kick 1,000 VFL/AFL goals — announces his retirement from the game.

title.children: 'What a journey': Buddy Franklin announces immediate retirement after injuring his calf in final match

image.altText: A sinkhole on a cement walkway.

items.synopsis: A local geologist says the limestone sinkhole was probably last open more than 5,000 years ago until the Mount Gambier volcano erupted and filled it with ash.

title.children: Mount Gambier's 4-metre-wide sinkhole an ancient cave previously filled by volcanic ash

image.altText: A blonde woman sitting on a bench

items.synopsis: Amid rising rents and house prices, the SA premier has announced more public and government worker housing in Mount Gambier, but others say smaller towns also need help.

title.children: Kelly's 'scary' spiral into homelessness in regional SA, where public housing will get a boost

image.altText: Michael Arnold stands in an orchard holding a blemished piece of citrus

items.synopsis: Citrus growers are struggling to produce fruit that meets market specifications and truckloads of rejected but "quality" oranges, tangelos and mandarins are being sent to feed cattle and sheep.

title.children: Tonnes of 'beautiful' oranges, mandarins dropped in paddocks as stockfeed

image.altText: A composite image of two men compiled from Facebook profile pictures.

items.synopsis: A man who gunned down two of his neighbours in a "senseless and brutally violent" dispute over a garden hose is likely to die in jail, after he is sentenced to 30 years' prison.

title.children: Melbourne pensioner who killed neighbours over garden hose dispute jailed for 30 years

image.altText: James Redmond Burrows walking in a city street.

items.synopsis: A court hears an accountant who has pleaded guilty to defrauding clients and the ATO, admitted his crimes to one of his victims, telling her if she had not "changed your login details when you did, I would have cleaned you out".

title.children: 'I've been ripping you off for a long, long time': Former accountant pleads guilty to fraud

image.altText: A wall of keep cups and mugs.

items.synopsis: There isn't a whole lot of consistency in Australia around what single-use plastics are being phased out and when. See what's happening in your state.

title.children: Single-use plastic coffee cups are being banned in some states. What's happening where you live?

image.altText: People stand around a large object on a beach

items.synopsis: The Australian Space Agency concludes the mysterious object found on Green Head beach was mostly likely debris from a satellite launch vehicle.

title.children: Origin of space junk that washed up on WA beach revealed amid push for object to be turned into tourist attraction

image.altText: A ship pulls Taipan wreckage from the ocean, authorities are in a smaller watercraft nearby

items.synopsis: Today's latest news, as it happens.

title.children: Catch up with the Loop:  AFL player Lance 'Buddy' Franklin a no-show at own retirement press conference

image.altText: woman looking into the camera

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has been told accused murderer Justin Kent Dilosa had "not one reason whatsoever" to kill Danielle Easey having only just met her.

title.children: Accused murderer only met Danielle Easey 36 hours before she was killed, court hears

image.altText: A large mountain towers over a camping ground.

items.synopsis: Five "ill-prepared" tourists have "veered off course" during their descent from the summit of Mount Roland in Tasmania, sparking a rescue mission and a plea from police that all bushwalkers "not rely on mobile phones for communication or navigation".

title.children: Tourists rescued after 'ill-prepared' mountain trek in Tasmania's central north

image.altText: man in suit with police officer in background

items.synopsis: The ABC is relying on a defence of public interest in the ongoing defamation case on allegations of war crimes by Australian forces.

title.children: 'Real fight' in Heston Russell defamation trial will be whether public interest defence claim is 'reasonable', barrister argues

image.altText: Clare O'Neil holds a newspaper reading "AFP won't cop pay cut" as she speaks to reporters

items.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil announces an independent review of "integrity and governance arrangements" of contracts within her department.

title.children: Clare O'Neil announces independent review of Home Affairs contracts after 'serious' Nauru allegations

image.altText: a cow with lumps and lesions on its skin.

items.synopsis: In recent days, Indonesia has stopped importing live cattle from four Australian export facilities over fears relating to lumpy skin disease.

title.children: Indonesia says cattle that arrived from Australia have lumpy skin disease. So what is it and why does it matter?

image.altText: Soccer teams wearing different kits in green and yellow designs pose for photos in the 80s, 90s, and 2010s

items.synopsis: From hand-me-down Socceroos jerseys to period-proof shorts, the evolution of the Matildas' kits reflects the broader growth of women's football.

title.children: From wearing 'tents' to 3D modelled shorts — inside the evolution of the Matildas playing kit

image.altText: A digital image of a young Aboriginal woman with long dark hair

items.synopsis: Australian Federal Police scientists release a digitised image of 'The Woman in Yellow', thanks to advancements in DNA and facial reconstruction technology.

title.children: Facial reconstruction of 'The Woman in Yellow' released to help crack 1987 missing persons case

image.altText: A jetty with no-one walking on it on a calm winter's day

items.synopsis: The death of a woman whose body was found in the water at an Adelaide beach is being treated as non-suspicious.

title.children: Death of woman found near Adelaide jetty treated as non-suspicious

image.altText: Man standing in front of yellow house smiles at the camera on sunny day.

items.synopsis: Regional WA has some of the most popular spots for sea and tree-changers — although some country areas in other states are experiencing an exodus of residents.

title.children: One in five city dwellers tempted by country lifestyle to escape cost of living, 'hectic' pace

image.altText: Women and children sit on a garden ledge holding placards

items.synopsis: The trial of four people accused of the murder of Cassius Turvey has been set down for February 2025. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised that this article contains an image of a person who has died, used with the permission of their family.

title.children: Four people charged with murder of Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey set to face trial in 2025

image.altText: Two photos side-by-side of a crashed light plane upside down on grass

items.synopsis: The horse involved in Sunday's light plane crash on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula has been put down, police say.

title.children: Horse hit by plane during attempted take-off in regional SA dies

image.altText: A pretty cactus with white spots on it in a black pot against a black background. Looks like a rabbit's ears.

items.synopsis: Authorities urge consumers to do their homework to ensure the seeds and plants they are buying or selling are not on the prohibited list, as ignorance will be no protection against hefty fines.

title.children: Sales of invasive, illegal plants online are growing — and buying them could cost you

image.altText: Sam Kerr looks sad during a press conference in Brisbane

items.synopsis: A decision on whether superstar Sam Kerr can play in the Matildas' must-win Women's World Cup game against Canada will be a late call, according to coach Tony Gustavsson.

title.children: Sam Kerr decision 'down to the wire', says Gustavsson, admitting Matildas' World Cup could be a 'failure'

items.synopsis: Squawks, creaky doors, trills, bellows and a lot of grunts — our wildlife makes some bizarre and beguiling noises. But which one should get the shout-out as Australia's favourite animal sound? It's time to make a call.

title.children: From kookaburra cackles to bonk of the banjo frog: Only one can be crowned Australia's favourite animal sound

image.altText: A Moroccan player wearing a hijab receives a big hug from a teammate after a game.

items.synopsis: Amid Morocco's celebrations of their first World Cup win, defender Nouhaila Benzina fell to the grass and cried. By wearing a hijab, she had created history and become a role model for millions, writes Samantha Lewis.

title.children: As a role model to millions of hijab-wearing Muslim women, Nouhaila Benzina makes history for Morocco

image.altText: A man leans on a pole reading a piece of paper.

items.synopsis: Wally Lewis reveals he has been diagnosed with probable chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) – describing his shock after seeing scans of brain that even made his doctor tear up.

title.children: 'I'm not seeking sympathy': Rugby League legend Wally Lewis diagnosed with probable CTE

image.altText: An Indian man and woman smiling, with a plate of Indian food in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Jay and Dhruti Ahir say their new start-up is based on the original tiffin service of Mumbai — a home-cooked food delivery system that's more than 130 years old.

title.children: Modern take on old tradition brings Indian Tasmanians flavours from home
